title: How to Make a Lucky Charms Pie

steps.headline: Get a box of Lucky Charms cereal.
steps.description: Sort out all of the harder marshmallow pieces into a separate bowl. Once complete, you should be left with two bowls - one of the oat cereal and one of the marshmallows. The oat cereal will be used first in this recipe.

steps.headline: Grind up the oat cereal in a blender until the pieces are coarse and grain-like.
Take the oat cereal grains out and add the butter to the mixture.
Use the oat and butter mixture to form the pie shell.
steps.description: Line the bottom and sides of a circular pie dish with the mixture. Refrigerate this until needed later.

steps.headline: Prepare the white-marshmallow filling.
steps.description: In a pan over a low heat, pour in the milk with all of the regular white marshmallows. Stir until all of it is combined. Remove once the entire mixture is almost completely liquid, but still at the edge of its solid form.

steps.headline: Prepare the bottom layer.
steps.description: Combine the cream cheese and the half-and-half, and add it into the marshmallow mix you combined earlier. Add in the vanilla extract. Stir this well. If necessary, use a blender to beat the cream cheese until it forms small, soft clumps and can be easily combined with the other ingredients.

steps.headline: Place equal amounts of the mixture into 3-4 separate dishes.
steps.description: Add a different food coloring to each dish and mix.

steps.headline: Put each of these mixtures into their own piping bag.
steps.description: Pipe out all of the colorful mixtures into the pie shell. Pipe one layer at a time, filling to the edge; then work on the second layer and repeat until all four layers have been piped evenly. Don't let the colorful layers run together as you pipe. If you need to smooth a layer, use the back of a clean spoon until the cream reaches the edges, while trying not to let the colors merge together.

steps.headline: Add the Lucky Charms marshmallows you sorted out earlier to the top of the pie.
steps.description: Place the pie in a freezer for at least 90 minutes.

steps.headline: Get it ready to serve!
steps.description: Disassemble the sides of the pie pan if needed. Some of the marshmallows may fall off, but this is normal - you can put them back on afterward.

text: Get a box of Lucky Charms cereal. Sort out all of the harder marshmallow pieces into a separate bowl. Once complete, you should be left with two bowls - one of the oat cereal and one of the marshmallows. The oat cereal will be used first in this recipe. Grind up the oat cereal in a blender until the pieces are coarse and grain-like.  Take the oat cereal grains out and add the butter to the mixture. Stir together. Use the oat and butter mixture to form the pie shell. Line the bottom and sides of a circular pie dish with the mixture. Refrigerate this until needed later. Prepare the white-marshmallow filling. In a pan over a low heat, pour in the milk with all of the regular white marshmallows. Stir until all of it is combined. Remove once the entire mixture is almost completely liquid, but still at the edge of its solid form. Prepare the bottom layer. Combine the cream cheese and the half-and-half, and add it into the marshmallow mix you combined earlier. Add in the vanilla extract. Stir this well. If necessary, use a blender to beat the cream cheese until it forms small, soft clumps and can be easily combined with the other ingredients. Place equal amounts of the mixture into 3-4 separate dishes. Add a different food coloring to each dish and mix. Put each of these mixtures into their own piping bag. Pipe out all of the colorful mixtures into the pie shell. Pipe one layer at a time, filling to the edge; then work on the second layer and repeat until all four layers have been piped evenly. Don't let the colorful layers run together as you pipe. If you need to smooth a layer, use the back of a clean spoon until the cream reaches the edges, while trying not to let the colors merge together. Add the Lucky Charms marshmallows you sorted out earlier to the top of the pie. Place the pie in a freezer for at least 90 minutes. Get it ready to serve! Disassemble the sides of the pie pan if needed. Some of the marshmallows may fall off, but this is normal - you can put them back on afterward.
